page.title: 07Gargrave, The Churches.
page.content:
Activities of the{Church of England} are centred on{St. Andrew's}Church,a mid-Victorian building, built on to a tower of c.1520. The{Methodists}worship in what was formerly the Wesleyan School, as their Chapel became unsafe , and had to be demolished in 1970. Mass for the{Roman Catholics}is celebrated in the Village Hall. Members of{other denominations}are not catered for in the village, and most of them go to Skipton.
Gargrave is renowned locally for the annual presentation by the{Religious {Drama Society}of a{Nativity Play}and a{Passion Play.}These have been a feature of village life since 1949, and involve all denominations.
